title: Nigeria: Buhari Appoints Kachikwu, Dambatta As NNPC, NCC Bosses
text:
Nigeria: Discos Seeks Help Over N31 Billion Military, MDA Debts 
Dawha was appointed to the position in August 2014 following the removal of his predecessor, Andrew Yakubu, by former President Goodluck Jonathan. 
A statement by the special adviser to the president on media and publicity, Mr. Femi Adesina, noted that Dr. Kachikwu, who until his appointment was the executive vice chairman and general counsel of Exxon-Mobil (Africa), is to take over from Dawha with immediate effect. 
A native of Onicha-Ugbo in Delta State, Kachikwu is a first-class graduate of Law from the University of Nigeria, Nsukka, and the Nigerian Law School. He also holds Masters and Doctorate Degrees in Law from the Harvard Law School. 
The new NNPC GMD started his working career with the Nigerian/American Merchant Bank before moving to Texaco Nigeria Limited where he remained for about eight years before joining ExxonMobil. 
I'll Work To Achieve President's Growth Aspiration for Oil and Gas Industry - Kachikwu 
Meanwhile, the newly appointed NNPC GMD immediately assumed duty as the chief executive of the Corporation at a brief handover ceremony held at the NNPC Towers, Abuja, yesterday, according to a statement by the Corporation's spokesman, Ohi Alegbe. 
Block leakages, start immediate reforms, experts urge new NNPC GMD 
Reacting to the appointment of the new NNPC GMD, the director general of the Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry (LCCI), Muda Yusuf, urged him to endeavour to run the corporation in a very transparent way. 
"The NNPC is a strategic institution but has been a platform for leakages. He should know that the economy significantly relies on the oil and gas industry, and for the economy and people of Nigeria to have full value of that sector, whosoever is in charge must be relevantly sincere and ready to support economic growth," Yusuf said. 
Describing Kachikwu's appointment as good choice, industry analyst, Dan Kunle, stated that with his wealth of experience and understanding of the local environment, the new NNPC GMD should be able to lead the much needed reforms in the sector. 
He explained that coming from ExxonMobil, a leading player in Nigeria's offshore, Kachikwu has valid experience of the underlining issues of the Nigerian oil and gas sector. 
On his part, the executive secretary, Depot and Petroleum Products Marketers Association (DAPMMA), Olufemi Adebayo Adewole, asserted that, from his background, the new GMD is "a round peg in a round hole." 
PMB Appoints Prof Umar Garba Dambatta As EVC of NCC 
President Muhammadu Buhari yesterday appointed Prof Umar Garba Dambatta as the executive vice chairman of the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC). 
Dambatta, who hails from Kano State, was born in Dambatta local government council. 
He obtained his BEng, MSc and PhD degrees from the Technical University of Wroclaw in Poland and the University of Manchester Institute of Science and Technology, UK, respectively. 
He served as a lecturer in the Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Technology of Bayero University, Kano, for 28 years, where he taught courses in telecommunication engineering and electronics and held academic positions of Dean of the Faculty and Head of Department at different times. 
Danbatta, who had served two terms of five years as a Member of Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN), is also a COREN registered engineer and member of the Nigerian Society of Engineers (NSE). 
He was the vice president of the Digital Bridge Institute (DBI), International Centre for Advanced Communications Studies, which was established in 2004 by the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) to build capacity for the Nigerian/African telecom industry in the diverse areas of Information and Communication Technology (ICT). 
Until his appointment, he was the acting vice chancellor, Kano University of Science and Technology, Wudil. More on This
